events.title: Argentine Tango in West Hartford, CT
events.description:
Do you tango? Tango Sueño Academy returns to Hartford area, at the Fred Astaire West Hartford starting April. Join us for weekly Saturday tango!

– 11:30 – 12:30 am: Essentials for all
– 12:30 – 1:30 pm: Intermediate tango
privates by appointment
$25 one hour, $40 both (with monthly registration),
IN APRIL ONLY: first hour $15 (save 40%) second hour $15 ($30 both)
Registration and further details: www.tangosueno.com

__________

Tango Sueño Academy is the premier Argentine Tango school in Connecticut, serving elite dancers for more than 18 years under the direction of Jorge “Gem” Duras. The group and private lessons focus on authentic Argentine Tango as danced and performed in the halls of Buenos Aires. The classes take place in Stamford, New Haven, Hartford and Danbury metropolitan areas as well as Westchester NY.

Gem has been dancing Argentine Tango for more than 26 years and teaching professionally since 2003. He trains and encourages his students to acquire the proper tango technique, so that they can create the sensuality, musicality and partner connection that the Argentine Tango is famous for.

Although Tango Sueño Academy offers choreography and performance classes for more advanced students, the essence of tango “where the two partners become one” is never forgotten, with the goal of enabling the students to dance with others at local tango events and throughout the world including Buenos Aires.

organizer.description:
Tango Sueño Academy, Argentine Tango classes, milongas and workshops throughout Connecticut.

 

Tango Sueño Academy is the premier Argentine Tango school in Connecticut, serving elite dancers for more than 18 years under the direction of Jorge “Gem” Duras.

The group and private lessons focus on authentic Argentine Tango as danced and performed in the halls of Buenos Aires. The classes take place in Stamford, New Haven, Hartford and Danbury metropolitan as well as Westchester NY.

Gem has been dancing Argentine Tango for more than 26 years and teaching professionally since 2003. He trains and encourages his students to acquire the proper tango technique, so that they can create the sensuality, musicality and partner connection that the Argentine Tango is famous for.

Although Tango Sueño Academy offers choreography and performance classes for more advanced students, the essence of tango “where the two partners become one” is never forgotten, with the goal of enabling the students to dance with others at local tango events and throughout the world including Buenos Aires.

The group classes are supplemented with various activities such as milongas, practicas and student performaces, as well as special events with guest instructors.

events.title: TANGO 1: BEGINNER
events.description:
Want to learn Argentine Tango?! Join us at The Fernanda Ghi Dance Academy, a boston- based school that specializes in authentic Argentine Tango.
Things to know:
– This class is for people with no prior experience, or folks who have danced tango before but want to learn a different role
– No partner required
– You will have fun
DROP INS ARE WELCOME ON THE FIRST CLASS OF THE SERIES:
Saturday 3/8| $22
OR
REGISTER FOR THE WHOLE SERIES:
What to Wear:
– Shoes with suede or leather soles, socks, or socks worn over the outside of the shoe. (Shoes should be able to slide and pivot on a wood floor without catching. We do not recommend street shoes with rubber or plastic soles.)
​
– ​Comfortable clothes that you can move in

categories.name: Progressive Class
categories.description: Each week adds to the previous weeks lessons

tags.name: Beginner
tags.description: Just starting, but know a step or 2, and have taken some lessons or classes

venue.description: The Fernanda Ghi Dance Company (FGDC) is dedicated to creating a fusion between Argentine Tango and other forms of art, such as music, theater, other styles of dance, and the visual arts. The company embraces Argentine Tango as an ever-evolving language, one with the ability to meld different mediums in dynamic and unexpected ways. At it’s core, tango is a form of communication – through the embrace of two people, opposing energies can be harnessed to move as one. While, FGDC is not limited to Tango alone, we use it as our language of connection and gateway to exploration.

organizer.description:
FERNANDA GHI DANCE ACADEMY PHILOSOPHY
The Fernanda Ghi Dance Academy (FGDA) specializes in a wholistic approach to teaching Authentic Argentine Tango. Rather than teach you a pattern of steps, we offer programing that trains your BODY, MIND + SOUL. Argentine Tango is a social dance as well powerful form of art. Our curriculum reflects a commitment to teach tango in all of its many facets- from beginner social dancers to professional artists. We treat anyone who walks through our doors like a dancer. This means providing multiple ways to train your body and your mind to reach your own personal goals in dance.

​Our classes range from specific topics in tango, to more general movement classes for stretching or facilitating body awareness. We are proud to offer body work to our students to help them maintain their physical health and agility.

TANGO AS A SOCIAL DANCE
We provide instruction for absolute beginners to advanced dancers interested in tango as a social dance. Our teaching is focused on continuity and quality. This means from your very first tango lesson, you will be taught from a consistent and carefully planned curriculum. Our technique builds strong, versatile and musical social dancers who understand the culture of tango.

TANGO AS AN ART FORM
We approach Argentine Tango as one would any other classical dance. To be a tango artist / performer requires a serious commitment to training and technique. FGDA provides training for professional tango dancers, and professional dancers from other backgrounds that are looking to expand their movement and partnering skills.

events.title: TANGO 2 + 3: INTERMEDIATE
events.description:
TANGO 2+3: INTERMEDIATE
At the beginning of each month a new series on a new topic begins.

MAR 8, 15, 22, 29 // $100

– Pre-Registration for is required

Instructor: Mia Dalglish
1:15- 2:30pm

Course Description: This class is for people with a little prior experience in tango. We will be working on building a strong foundation of leading + following techniques so there is clear communication when moving as a couple. This class works on basic vocabulary of tango, and putting it in the line of dance.

Registration:
PAYMENT // Cancellation + Purchasing Policy for Group Lessons:

– Registration for Tango 2 + 3 is done by the series (no drop-ins). Registration is still permitted with up to one class absence per series, however, we must be informed at the time of registration. In this case, the Single Class Pass rate ($30 per session) will be charged for the number of sessions you are attending.

– Full payment is due on the first day of each series. All payments are non-refundable and non-transferrable to future sessions. Refunds and / or class credit will not be issued for absences that are not planned by the first day of the series. ​

– Your spot is reserved especially for you, so these classes are not transferable to another person (unless prior consent is given from Instructor).

– To get the discounted series price, you must register for the full series.

– If you are unable to complete the class due to an illness, injury or any other circumstance you must notify your instructor to let them know you will be absent. Your instructor will let you know if there is a makeup class that you can attend at another time during the week.

events.title: UT – Open Level –  CHE TANGO! – Saturday Afternoon Practica at ULTIMATE TANGO
events.description:
CHE TANGO! – Saturday Afternoon Practica at ULTIMATE TANGO 
 Walk in. Dance out. Laugh throughout.
 Saturdays | 3-6 PM
 Ultimate Tango – 349 Washington St, Malden, MA 02155
 FREE PARKING for 50+ cars!
 Just a 3-min walk from Oak Grove T stop (Orange Line).
 What’s in store?
Welcome to Che Tango!, the most laid-back, slightly ridiculous, and irresistibly charming Argentine Tango Practica in town. We dance, we snack, we sip mini beers like it’s 1955 in a forgotten tango bar somewhere between Buenos Aires and your Eastern European grandma’s kitchen.
The tables are dressed in red-checkered plastic, the air smells faintly of good cheese and kielbasa, and the beer flows from large bottles into tiny glasses—just as it should. Expect smooth tangos, clumsy tangos, giggly tangos, and maybe even a polka or two if we get carried away.
Come practice your embrace, argue about technique, and refuel with bread, pickles, and laughter. No pressure, just good old-fashioned fun and great company.
Shoes optional, socks welcome (after all, if you spell “socks” out loud, you get es-o-ke-es—eso qué es? Exactly).
Good humor required. Bring your best tango face and your worst tango excuses.
 PRICING:
 Entry: $15
 Bring a Friend: $20 for both (both leaders or both followers—totally fine!)
 Wear Ridiculous Socks: Get $2 off (One discount per person – no sock bribery loopholes!)
 MUSIC BRIBES (a.k.a. DJ Ransom System)
 Tip $20 = Force the DJ to play traditional tango for 3 tandas.
 Tip $20 = Support the DJ’s “artistic freedom” (aka, neo-tango experiments) for 3 tandas.
 Shoes optional, socks encouraged.
 Good humor required.
 Bring your best tango face and your worst tango excuses.
 Tag your tango friends! The more, the merrier… or at least, the weirder.
 See you on the dance floor at Ultimate Tango!
MORE INFO: https://www.ultimatetango.com/che-tango

categories.name: Practica
categories.description: Guided or not, this is typically a practice space where the line of dance may or may not be respected, and not necessarily enforced. Anything goes. There are men dancing with men, women dancing with women, and mixed gendered couples. Typically the music is played in Tandas, and there are Cortinas. The rules of the Milonga are applied: a.) Followers must wait to be asked. b.) Leads typically ask for dances using cabeceo, chateseo, siteseo, walkbyeseo, yelleseo, grabeseo, and Followers indicate via Mirada that they’re interested. 3.) The line of dance is sort of observed. 4.) Tandas/Cortinas vs. Continuous Music. Sometimes, depending on the Practica, an area in the middle is designated as a dedicated Practica Area, and there are one or two outer tracks to simulate a dancing environment.

organizer.description:
Don’t Repeat Mindlessly. Learn Through Understanding.

Here, at Ultimate Tango you will find all you need to become a true member of the Tango community in Boston MA and worldwide. We focus on developing in you the true understanding of what Tango is. Argentine Tango is not just a dance. It’s a philosophy.  A way of comprehending the world. A way of building relationships Indeed, a way of understanding yourself.

Ultimate Tango, the Premier Boston tango studio,  has been helping Boston, MA residents master the art of the tango in exciting ways. We take pride in being the premier Boston, MA tango studio and working with students of all ages and skill levels.

events.title: Tango Encuentros for advanced dancers
events.description:
Attention all tango lovers! 💃🕺

We have some amazing news! Two of the best tango instructors in Boston Guillermo Merlo and Laura Grandi are teaming up to challenge your dance, and take it to the next level.

🔹 Don’t miss the chance to improve your dance with the best!

Starting on April 5, 2025 and every first Saturday of the month, we will have 2 intensive hours of tango for advanced students only.
This Intensive is designed for those who already have a strong foundation in tango and want to refine their connection, technique, musicality, and complex movements.

IMPORTANT:
You must register/come with a partner. The class will be balanced with enough leaders and followers.
You can choose whatever role you wish and may choose not to change partners.
If you choose to change partner, then you must adjust your role to the new partner.

🔹 First class: April 5th, from 3 to 5 PM at Dance Union.

🎟️ Reserve your spot now! We recommend you register for the class and let us know what role you will be choosing for the class. Both partners must register.

Are you ready to explore, investigate and work hard to take your dance to a better place? This is your class

Register Now!

categories.name: Practica
categories.description: Guided or not, this is typically a practice space where the line of dance may or may not be respected, and not necessarily enforced. Anything goes. There are men dancing with men, women dancing with women, and mixed gendered couples. Typically the music is played in Tandas, and there are Cortinas. The rules of the Milonga are applied: a.) Followers must wait to be asked. b.) Leads typically ask for dances using cabeceo, chateseo, siteseo, walkbyeseo, yelleseo, grabeseo, and Followers indicate via Mirada that they’re interested. 3.) The line of dance is sort of observed. 4.) Tandas/Cortinas vs. Continuous Music. Sometimes, depending on the Practica, an area in the middle is designated as a dedicated Practica Area, and there are one or two outer tracks to simulate a dancing environment.

venue.description: Home of The Tango Society of Boston Events.

organizer.description:
ABOUT LAURA GRANDI

I started my first steps in 1997.

From that time until today I had training with different masters of Buenos Aires in tango and other expressions of dance.​​ Throughout my career I did presentations and exhibitions in different national and internationals milongas and clubs.

Nowadays I am based in Massachusetts

events.title: UT – Advanced Level – Elevating Technique, Connection, and Expression – couples only only
events.description:
This exclusive, invitation-only course for couples is designed for experienced tango dancers seeking to refine their skills and elevate their dance to the next level. With a strong focus on precision, connection, and improvisation, this ongoing program will help you integrate advanced tango elements seamlessly into your movement while maintaining balance, fluidity, and musicality.
Each class will delve into intricate giros, advanced sacadas, enrosques, planeos, changes of direction, and dynamic musical interpretation, all while honing technique and deepening partner connection. The curriculum emphasizes controlled axis, refined torsions, and weight transfer, ensuring that each movement is executed with clarity and confidence.
This course is by invitation only and open exclusively to couples who are comfortable with foundational tango mechanics and ready to explore more sophisticated techniques. To inquire about participation, please email ultimateTango@gmail.com for more information.
The classes are held at 349 Washington St, Malden, MA 02148.
– 50 parking spots available.
– 2 min walk from Oak Grove T stop.

events.title: Milonga NUEVA
events.description:
Welcome to… Milonga Nueeeeeeeeva!

Here’s what you need to know:

🕗 Time: 8pm to 1am-ish
📍 Location: Dance Union, 16 Bow St, Somerville, MA
❤️ Your gracious hosts: Corin and Milton

🚙 Free Parking – no problems!: Bow St, Somerville Ave, Market Basket
🚕 Free Parking – but be careful: parking designated for Citizens Bank and Goodyear Tire. You should be ok parking there but there have been issues in the past so proceed with caution.
🚕 Paid Parking: Ebi Sushi lot and in front of the Independent
🚗 Restricted Parking: residential parking within the Citizens Bank parking lot

💰 Milonga Admission:
— General Public: $20
— Full-Time Students: $15
— Out-of-Towners (>30 miles away): $15

See YOU at the party! 🎉

🎧 Only the best DJs, 4-Vals Tandas, Community Tanda, and Chacarera!

Click here for the official event page for the next Milonga NUEVA!:
https://www.facebook.com/events/420781880312044

Click on this link to register (now recommended but not required) to be an official and VIP Nueva member!:
https://forms.gle/NS8L46snXUQGJWfZ8

Wanna know more!? Visit our Facebook group and become a member for all the latest info!:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/milonganueva

categories.name: Milonga
categories.description: Milonga typically are evening based, have a dress code, and no 'lessons' on the floor. Newbies may watch, but may have a hard time participating. Solid dance techniques and floor management is expected to attend.
